reviews.text: This Courtyard appears to have been here for quite a while, but the interior is completely remodeled. The rooms are brand new, with great beds, all new furnishings and LCD TVs. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful - more so than we've experienced at some luxury hotels.
reviews.title: Nicely remodeled - great place to stay!

reviews.text: The location is in a business park, but it's convenient to the freeway and there are lots of restaurants within a short drive.
reviews.title: Loved It

reviews.text: We've stayed here twice - both were great experiences. This is our preferred hotel in this part of Portland.
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.text: Great location, close to everything. Went North to Portland and the Zoo and South to the outlet mall. The rooms were very spacious & clean and we really liked the balcony. There was a Starbucks right next door, nothing bad to say about this place.
reviews.title: Great Courtyard experience

reviews.text: Arrived late on a Friday for a local football game - room was quiet, clean and spacious.
reviews.title: great, comfortable stay!

reviews.text: The price was amazing ($61.00), the room was very very small, the staff was nice if not uninformed (more on that in a moment), the location pretty good, I heard the breakfast was good, and the walking paths complete with waterfalls, ponds, grass, benches, and Canada geese were very nice. The downfall of our trip was a middle of the night illness where we needed to find a hospital, and the front desk staff had no clue where to send us. They finally printed up a map off of a web search that took us the back way towards a hospital through a residential area, and we got completely lost. As my husband said, that is the kind of information that should be right there and very handy for the staff to have. So, not their fault per se, but an awful trip with most of it spent in hospitals. Starbuck's, located in the same parking lot as the hotel, was a godsend. There were shopping and restaurants nearby, though we didn't eat at any. And the highlight of my trip was walking the paths several blocks to Home Depot, where I did some window shopping in the nursery. The geese were fun to see, and they were very friendly to people. All in all The hotel experience was fine, however the room could have been a tad larger with 3 of us staying in it. It was clean, sheets were very soft, and the bed was comfy (since that was where I spent most of my time).
reviews.title: Worst trip ever, not Marriott's fault
